As It Was Said🔽The Collection on Three Things
The fourth sub-chapter
The cry of the gods

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One:

original: “Tayome, bhikkhave, devesu devasaddā niccharanti samayā samayaṁ upādāya.
analyzed: tayo me bhikkhave devesu deva saddāḥ niccharanti samayā samayam upādāya
translated: “Monks, three cries of the gods occur among the gods on certain occasions.
What are the three?

original: Yasmiṁ, bhikkhave, samaye ariyasāvako kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāya ceteti, tasmiṁ samaye devesu devasaddo niccharati:
analyzed: yasmin bhikkhave samaye ariya sāvakaḥ kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajjāya ceteti tasmin samaye devesu deva saddaḥ niccharati
translated: When a noble disciple shaves off their hair and beard, dons the yellow robe, and goes forth from the home life into homelessness, on that occasion the cry goes up among the gods:

analyzed: esaḥ ariya sāvakaḥ mārena saddhim saṅgāmāya ceta iti iti
translated: ‘This noble disciple is resolved to do battle with Māra.’

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo devesu devasaddo niccharati samayā samayaṁ upādāya.
analyzed: bhikkhave paṭhamaḥ devesu deva saddaḥ niccharati samayā samayam upādāya
translated: This is the first cry of the gods that occurs among the gods on certain occasions.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, yasmiṁ samaye ariyasāvako sattannaṁ bodhipakkhiyānaṁ dhammānaṁ bhāvanānuyogamanuyutto viharati, tasmiṁ samaye devesu devasaddo niccharati:
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave yasmin samaye ariya sāvakaḥ sattannam bodhi pakkhiyānam dhammānam bhāvanā anuyogam anuyuttaḥ viharati tasmin samaye devesu deva saddaḥ niccharati
translated: Furthermore, when a noble disciple lives devoted to the development of the seven sets of qualities that are beneficial, on that occasion the cry goes up among the gods:

analyzed: esaḥ ariya sāvakaḥ mārena saddhim saṅgāma iti
translated: ‘This noble disciple is doing battle with Māra.’

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, dutiyo devesu devasaddo niccharati samayā samayaṁ upādāya.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, yasmiṁ samaye ariyasāvako āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ
analyzed: bhikkhave dutiyaḥ devesu deva saddaḥ niccharati samayā samayam upādāya  puna capara bhikkhave yasmin samaye ariya sāvako āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimutti
translated: This is the second sound that occurs among the gods that occurs on an occasion that is timely.

original: paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati, tasmiṁ
analyzed: paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati tasmin
translated: “Again, on an occasion when a noble disciple, through the destruction of the taints, realizes for himself with direct knowledge, in this very life, the taintless liberation of mind, liberation by wisdom, and having entered upon it, dwells in it,
on that occasion the gods let loose a cry:

original: ‘eso ariyasāvako vijitasaṅgāmo tameva saṅgāmasīsaṁ abhivijiya ajjhāvasatī’ti.
analyzed: esaḥ ariya sāvakaḥ vijita saṅgāmaḥ tam eva saṅgāma sīsam abhivijiya ajjhāvasati iti
translated: ‘This noble disciple has won the battle and now lives the victor’s life.’

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, tatiyo devesu devasaddo niccharati samayā samayaṁ upādāya.
analyzed: bhikkhave tatiyaḥ devesu deva saddaḥ niccharati samayā samayam upādāya
translated: This is the third sound that occurs among the gods that occurs on an occasion that is timely.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo devesu devasaddā niccharanti samayā samayaṁ upādāyā”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave tayo devesu deva saddāḥ niccharanti samayā samayam upādāya ati  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: These are the three sounds that occur among the gods that occur on an occasion that is timely.”🔽The Blessed One said this.
And in this connection this was said:
“Having seen the one who has won the battle,
the disciple of the Fully Enlightened One,
Even the gods pay homage to him,
the great one who has overcome the dart.
Homage to you, O enlightened one,
You who have conquered the hard-to-conquer middle,
Having conquered the army of Death,
With the unimpeded liberation.
Therefore they revere you,
The gods, the pure-hearted,
For they do not see that by which
One would come under Death’s sway.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This is the meaning of what was said by the Blessed One, so I have heard.
The third.
